data.title: The Medical City
data.meta_description: Helping You Care For Your Health
data.text:
Our Services

TMC Main’s world-class facility is the staging area for the delivery of cutting-edge healthcare services with Institutes in Regenerative Medicine, Wellness and Aesthetics, Cardiovascular, Cancer, the Neurological Sciences, Eye and Vision, ENT Head and Neck, Acute and Critical Care, Pediatrics, and Women’s Health.

In 2012, the world-leading Institute of Personalized Molecular Medicine (IPMM) was established to expand the Regenerative Medicine program of TMC. The IPMM offers a comprehensive range of clinical and laboratory services in molecular and cellular therapeutics, including stem cell therapies for both Filipino and international patients.

The Wellness and Aesthetics Institute is a one-stop shop for health maintenance, lifestyle management and promotion that delivers organized, personalized, seamless, and comprehensive services appropriate to various age groups – from the young to the young at heart. Moreover, its posh, two-story site merges style and professionalism for a distinct health care experience.

The Cardiovascular Institute offers cardiac expertise, integrated, state-of-the-art care, encompassing non-invasive diagnostics, minimally-invasive interventional services, open heart surgery, and cardiac rehabilitation.

The Augusto P. Sarmiento Cancer Institute (APSCI) adopts a unique multidisciplinary team approach to cancer prevention, early detection, diagnosis, and management. It applies innovative molecular technologies in diagnosis and treatment for truly customized care. TMC-APSCI’s latest offerings include the PET-CT scan, Intra Operative Radiation Therapy, and MRI Fusion Prostate Biopsy.

The Institute of the Neurological Sciences boasts of specialized neurological services housed in the Acute Stroke Unit (ACSU) and Neurological Intensive Care Unit (NICU), Neurosciences Center, Movement Disorders Clinic, Neurosurgery; as complemented by allied medical services in the Department of Psychiatry and Center for Behavioral Health. These specialty services are manned by well-equipped and highly-trained Neurologists, Neuropsychologist and Psychiatrists.

The Eye and Vision Institute provides world-class diagnostic, medical and surgical care of the eyes for adults and children. It offers a complete array of services for Cataract, Retina and vitreous, Refractive surgery, LASIK, Cornea and External Diseases, Glaucoma, Orbit and Plastic-Lacrimal, Pediatric Ophthalmology, Uveitis, Neuro-Ophthalmology, Low Vision and Comprehensive Ophthalmology.

The ENT, Head and Neck Institute specializes in the medical and surgical management of patients with ear, nose and throat (ENT) diseases and has further expanded into multi subspecialties in Otology, Rhinopharyngology, Laryngology, Head and Neck Surgery, Maxillofacial Surgery, Facial Plastic Surgery, and Pediatric ENT. The Institute also handles complicated diseases including malignant head and neck tumors, facial fractures, swallowing and voice disorders, and aesthetic facial deformities.

The Acute and Critical Care Institute (ACCI) integrates Emergency Medicine and Critical Care professionals, units, and programs to defend and maximize the quality of life for patients who suffer severe acute illness, through effective rescue and continuous support from the moment of first patient contact until functional recovery. The institute is the pioneer when it comes to Adult Critical Care Medicine (CCM) in the country.

The Institute of Pediatrics is at the forefront of pediatric medicine with over 100 pediatricians partnering with every parent every step of the way, offering 18 subspecialties to help children grow up to be strong and ready to face the world.

The Institute for Women’s Health provides quality healthcare services to meet the unique needs of women throughout their lives. Under the Institute is the Women’s Health Care Center (WHCC), a One-Stop Clinic for Assessment of Risk (OSCAR), a concept that is a first of its kind in the Philippines. This is a clinic for assessment of risks for abnormalities in almost all aspects of OB-GYN care.

In addition, the Clinical and Translational Research Institute (CTRI) provides an efficient and high quality research management system catering to the needs of clinical trialists and biomedical researchers under The Medical City (TMC) or any of its networks. CTRI wants to make TMC an exemplary research institution, and aims to help bridge the clinical research gap from the laboratory setting to its bedside application.

TMC also has a strong bone marrow transplant program with a remarkable success rate of over 90 percent for 2019 and successful liver transplant operations since 2016, making it the leader in the management of end-stage liver disease and liver transplantation in the Philippines.
